title: UFC taps Polymarket to add betting signals for live fight coverage
summary: Polymarket’s onchain prediction data and fan-sentiment feeds will be integrated across UFC events, creating a new interactive layer for viewers.

title: Bitcoin, Ethereum now operate in ‘different monetary’ universes: Data
summary: Bitcoin is turning into a savings-focused asset while Ethereum is becoming a high-velocity utility engine, a split that some analysts say is an emerging structural risk.

title: UK risks falling behind US, EU without GBP stablecoin: Fintech exec
summary: The British pound needs digital rails to remain competitive with the dollar and euro as the world shifts to onchain and internet-native finance.

title: BNY launches money market fund to hold reserves for US stablecoin issuers
summary: Built to align with the GENIUS Act, the new fund provides a regulated vehicle for holding stablecoin reserves in cash and US Treasurys.

title: Bitcoin falls to $98K as futures liquidations soar: Should bulls expect a bounce?
summary: Bitcoin data forecast the drop to $98,000 as key supports failed to generate hefty buying from bulls, and futures traders saw their long positions liquidated.

title: 21Shares launches crypto index ETFs under SEC’s Act 40
summary: 21Shares’ new crypto index ETFs utilize the stricter 1940 Act framework, marking a shift toward traditional fund oversight for diversified digital asset exposure.

title: The most important crypto moments of the year
summary: The most influential crypto events of 2025 included sweeping regulatory moves, ecosystem expansion and the rise of new onchain trends.

title: Asset manager Grayscale files for US IPO
summary: The registration statement was made public about four months after the asset manager had filed confidentially for an initial public offering.

title: Last US penny minted shows why savers need Bitcoin
summary: The last US penny, which is valued at $0.01, costs about 3.7 times its face value to mint, as inflation erodes the value of fiat currency.

title: What happens if the Fed cuts rates before Christmas Eve?
summary: A pre-Christmas Fed rate cut could boost spending, shift bond yields, lift risk assets and increase demand for crypto.
